reviews.review_msg: Avoid her if you can. Terrible professor.

Anne is an incredibly kind person, and it's apparent in her treatment of her students. Her lectures are very informative, although she has a soft voice so I would recommend sitting close to the front. She's very helpful if you choose to pursue her outside of class, only down side is that she's very disorganized. Shame really.

She read off of other scholars notes and didn't have definitive plans for each class. Mainly read from the text as well and didn't hand back work from the semester, so you had to guess what you were going in with in the final. Overall a nice person but not a great lecturer.

Very seldom have I had a professor that I'd consider to be an actual TEACHER.  Anne seems to actually care about presenting ideas, conscious as to whether or not she engages the class, rather than merely being a conosour of literature.
Anne Higgins is probably the best prof I've ever had.  If you havn't been in one of her classes yet, you're missing out!!!

I never got one assignment back on time. Try handing your work in late and see what happens! Lectuures were off topic and usually had zero educational value. She actually admitted to giving unclear directions or the mid-term and still gave out bad grades.
Anne is very smart and loves new ideas. She is a very slow marker though.
lectures aren't great, funny lady in certain courses
goes off topic, no breaks during lectures
By far the best English prof at SFU! Not only does he love Shakespeare, he's pretty funny so the class never has a dull moment. I highly recommend taking any course he teaches, you won't regret it!

Articulate, smart, and genuinely a good guy. Hated Shakespeare in high-school, but it is a completely different experience with Budra. His lectures are very engaging and always well prepared. I've done Engl 313 on Distance Education as well, but it's just not the same, so I highly recommend taking an in-person class with him.
Decent analyses; gets entirely too much pleasure out of browbeating students for a grown man with a serious career.  Methinks the lady is insecure.
i am an english major and he is by far the best english prof at sfu
an awesome professor who made shakespeare exciting - definitely an asset for sfu
